summary: INITIALLY OIL LEAK AFTER OIL CHANGE.  WAS TOLD THAT TRANSMISSION PAN WAS LEAKING AND PAID FOR REPLACEMENT.  TRANSMISSION FLUID THEN STARTED LEAKING.  RETURNED VEHICLE TO DEALER; TRANSMISSION PAN WAS TIGHTENED.  NOTICED FLUID STILL LEAKING; RETURNED VEHICLE TO DEALERSHIP.  DEALERSHIP COULD NOT DETECT SOURCE OF FLUID LEAK; PLACED DIE IN OIL AND TRANSMISSION FLUIDS; ASKED TO RETURN VEHICLE IN A FEW WEEKS.  RETURNED VEHICLE TO DEALERSHIP; WAS TOLD THERE WAS A LEAK SURROUNDING ENGINE SEAL AND SEAL WOULD NEED TO BE REPAIRED.
